I recently restarted again after hospitalization with chest pain and unstable angina.  Now I take at night with most of my daily meds and I think it helps me sleep.  I have only taken a few days now but so far so good!

column9: Have been taking this medication, 30 mg,  in addition to Bystolic and Benicar for about 6 weeks and have had no problems. I take tylenol to reduce the slight headache, but have noticed I tend to get nausous often.But I am happy with how I feel overall and feel this medication is worth any side effects.I didn't see anyone mention that they felt tired while on this med. I do feel tired a great deal of the time. Has anyone else noticed this or felt this med has this effect on them? I've thought about splitting the pill and taking 1/2 in the a.m. and 1/2 at bedtime. Going to ask cardiologist first.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Seems to be a miracle drug.  As of today, I have taken four doses before bed at night and the chest pain I was having from 5:30am-8:30am daily is gone. column2: butchies91, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication has been a life saver for me. I had preasure and pain in my chest with exercise and Imdur took care of it. The first heart doctor told me that the only releif I could fine would be with a stent never even mentioning the drug imdur. My second doctor  gave me a choice. Not only did imdur help me with my chest pain it also helped me with the circulation in my feet and my hands. I always had cold hands and cold blue feet. Now both these things are gone. I can not say enough about this medication and wonder why more doctors do not offer this to there patients as a first treatment before  going the stent route whic is still on the iffy list.

column2: Greg, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: from about an hour after taking Imdur in the moring until the evening I am rarely bothered by any angina pain unless I do something really strenuous. However, I find that by the evening, it is losing its effectiveness and I often need to use a nitrate spray to bost the effect. Overal I am very satisfied with Imdur and have had no significant side effects after more than 4 years of continuous use. I am also taking a very small amount of beta blocker and aspirin.

column2: jtremb3940@aol.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began a course of treatment with Imdur at 60 mg/day (AM) to treat an angina that arose with only minor to low physical activity. After about 3 weeks my MD increased my dose to 120 mg as I had been realizing minor relief. Within a few days at 120mg taken each morning, I began to notice that beginning in early-to mid-afternoon the angina returned. I have just requested my cardiologist to allow me to increase my am dose to 180mg each morning.   My side effects are the predicted dizziness if I stand up abruptly (I am watching this and managing to control the light-headedness by slowing down on standing. Recently I began with back of my head headaches that I manage with tylenol. I am so grateful for the Imdur; it has relieved my worries a great deal. Feel free to email me at jtremb3940@aol.com.  Jim T.
